intro: Reseda plinii, commonly known as the Italian Reseda, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, pink to white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are linear and slightly hairy, and it produces capsule fruits containing numerous small seeds. Reseda plinii is often cultivated for its ornamental value and historical use in dye production.
